title: 2015 video from Karachi (Pakistan) is shared with multiple misleading narratives
subtitle: Video shared as Shaheenbagh women caught doing prostitution under the guise of burqa is from Karachi (Pakistan), and was found on the internet since 2015.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A video of burqa-clad women escaping from a building is being shared on social media with a claim that Shaheenbagh women were caught being into prostitution under the guise of burqa. But, FACTLY found that the same video was found to be uploaded on YouTube and Facebook in 2015 with the title: ‘Sex workers fleeing after FIA raid at a brothel in Karachi’. So, the video is not related to Shaheenbagh and is not from India. The same video was earlier shared on social media as Muslim women fleeing from quarantine in Bangalore and as women jumping from a building after being locked by the Police for shopping during the lockdown. FACTLY had debunked these stories earlier and they can be read here and here.

Did you watch our new video?
